text: Black, lasting tan head.Big roasty,alcoholic & brown sugar nose.Big rich malt profile with medium roast bitterness

Bomber. Clear ruby hued deep dark brown, frothy mocha foam settles and lasts. Aroma of chocolate and coffee. Taste is dark roast, sweet darker milk chocolate and lightly bitter espresso bean. Average carbonation, medium bodied, low hopped. Surprisingly easy, but still: NFL (Not For Lagerboys)
On holiday in Canada 650ml bottle of black colored body with a off white head and with a sweet malt coffee aroma a coffee alcholic malt sweet bitter taste with a alcholic bitter finish

Very dark colour. Aroma is a coffeeish, smoky, roasty, appetizing nose. Has a sweet front, a light acidity from the coffee, a rich roasty character without bitterness (Timbertrain is one of the absolute best local roasters), creamy mouthfeel and a deliciously bitter, chocolatey finish. Very nice brew.

Bottle, shared at game night. Very dark brown, light brown head. Nice fresh coffee character, leaning towards mocha perhaps. Medium bodied, dry finish. The best Ive had from these guys in a long time!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle from Tony, thanks! Near black, aroma is coffee and very light smoke. Flavour is medium coffee and a slight tin, overall super nice
Pours black, chocolatey large head. Aroma of roasted coffee malts, taste is coffee and cream, good carbonation. This is a gooder.
I enjoyed this. Very nice black full bodied pour. Aromas of fresh coffee and cream. Tastes like it smells. Really great coffee flavours. Cream and sugar notes. Very nice.

Tasting at MattsDark brown color, near black, small color. The coffee aroma is very nice. Dry mouthfeel, roasted malt and coffee flavor, nice but nothing exceptional. Goes well with fatty food.Quite nice.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2016 Very good aroma with a lot of coffee (or even a little bit coffee with milk). The same in taste - the coffee (with some milk) with roasted malt bitterness, some dark fruits. Good.

650mL bottle, pours black with a small tan head. Aroma brings out lots of espresso and roast upfront. Flavour is along the same lines, with monolithic coffee / espresso notes, followed by a touch of roast. Very espresso-y and a touch of roast make this extremely enjoyable. Body is medium-light, but theres enough body to complement the flavour profile. One of Russells best beers. Very nice.

Bottle shared with northropfrye, poured in snifter. Smells kind of yeasty, which is a good thing. Appearance is dark body, mocha frothy head. Taste is pretty strong with coffee, nice bitterness. Palate is a touch oily, nice fizzy carbonation with a bitter finish.

Dark brown body, brown foamy head, nice lacing. Lactose, roasted, malts, coffee aroma. Taste is roasted barley, coffee, bout quite smooth, not harsh, semi-bitter, but a touch of sweetness in there as well. Smooth palate. Quite nice.

Bottle. Dark, nearly black pour with a mocha head. Aroma is strong, roasty coffee with some chocolate. Taste is tons of dark roast black coffee, pretty bitter and roasty, medium bodied and fairly simple. Would have liked a little more sweetness and richness to balance, but not a bad coffee stout if you like the bitterness.

650ml bottle pours black in color with a finger and a half of light brown head that leaves some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is chocolate and roasted grains with some herbal and coffee notes. Taste is a roasted grain and herbal bitterness with a chocolate malty sweetness with a subtle roasted coffee finish. Very nicely crafted coffee stout, enjoyable, tasty and balanced. Recommended.
